snippet: An order to buy gold bars and coins with ransom money was in a letter that was part of the trove seized by Navy SEALs at Bin Laden’s hide-out in Pakistan.
abstract: Washington Memo; document seized by Navy SEALs in 2011 raid on Osama Bin Laden's compound in Pakistan reveals he invested nearly $1.7 million in gold bars and coins; document offers glimpse into Al Qaeda's management of its finances and clues as to how other militants may seek to keep wealth safe from institutions and blacklists; falling gold prices also point to Bin Laden's faulty financial decisions.

byline.contributor: Alexandra Stevenson in New York contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: An order to buy gold bars and coins with ransom money was in a letter that was part of the trove seized by Navy SEALs at Bin Laden’s hide-out in Pakistan.

headline.print_headline: As an Investor, Bin Laden Was Bullish on Gold
headline.main: As an Investor, Osama bin Laden Was Bullish on Gold
